RT @snewbery1: Such a privilege to be here in Thunder Bay to hear ‚Å¶@AdamKassamMD‚Å© offer his presidential remarks to ‚Å¶@OntariosDoctors‚Å©. I‚Äôm‚Ä¶

‚ÄúOur Prescription for Ontario, with its 87 recommendations, details in one place, all the areas we need to fix to transform our health care system to benefit us now and for generations to come. We can be the generation of physicians that picks up this road map and leads the way.‚Äù

‚ÄúWith crisis, comes tremendous opportunity & we have begun to seize this with vaccines & virtual care, but that‚Äôs just the start. Out of all the issues we recently re-discovered, I am so glad that we have finally come to terms with the unacceptable nature of physician burnout.‚Äù

‚ÄúThis pandemic is a rare collective ‚Äúmoment‚Äù that we have experienced together. Our collective response to it will define us. I believe that we can capture this moment! We have shown enormous resolve & strength as we pivoted & learned on the fly & improved along the way.‚Äù
"I made an impassioned plea to the council delegates to consider me for physician leadership, wanting so badly to leverage my years of experience for good."

"I‚Äôve spent two decades in a hospital-based practice, working hundreds of emergency department shifts, & also doing medical, surgical, chronic care hospitalist work at @OSMH_News & now, am working as a mental health hospitalist at @WaypointCtr in Penetanguishene."
‚Äú@OntariosDoctors is 140 years old - that‚Äôs a lot of moments. All of those moments within the timeline of our lives are important. They make us who we are, today.‚Äù
@drrosezacharias begins her address as 2022-2023 @OntariosDoctors President.

@CMA_Docs President @KatharineSmart offers remarks and introduces President-elect 
@drrosezacharias

‚ÄúAnd, even in the face of our own struggle, our own battles ‚Äì with burnout & fatigue, bullying & harassment, directives & shutdowns ‚Äì you have continued to step up with professionalism, selflessness and a spirit of enduring service to your patients and communities.‚Äù

‚ÄúLooking back over the past year, we brought together stakeholders and system partners as the pandemic unfolded and our responsibility grew. We were called upon countless times by the media to help educate and navigate the public through this crisis.‚Äù

‚ÄúIt comes as no surprise then that our physicians have played a central and crucial role in the pandemic response ‚Äì and it‚Äôs further proof to the core belief that I hold: that there is no healthcare system without doctors.‚Äù

‚ÄúSo let me start by thanking you. Thanking you for your sacrifice. Thanking you for your dedication. Thanking you for your expertise. Thanking you for your leadership. And thanking you for helping to keep us all safe and healthy.‚Äù

‚ÄúTo say that there has been a complete upheaval in our profession and in our society would be an understatement. Practically overnight, our world was faced with a new pathogen that threatened the lives and livelihoods of ordinary people.‚Äù - Dr. @AdamKassamMD
Dr. @AdamKassamMD reflects on the past year as @OntariosDoctors President.

Congratulations to Dr. @AdamKassamMD, in being named OMA President-Elect. #OMACouncil2020 #ONhealth

"So stay safe out there, my friends and colleagues.

The winter of despair will give way to the spring of hope.‚ÄØ

The sun will rise and the season of darkness will give way to a new season of light.‚ÄØ

We shall see each other again, in person, soon."
"Because if not us, then who? With humility, I will take these forward, on behalf of us all. Win, lose or draw, I will never stop betting on physicians, and I will never stop fighting for all of us."

"These are important, and I remain dedicated to them. But today it appears we must also again fight the battles of educating the public and the government, standing strong in the face of a Goliath, and protecting our health care system."
‚Ä¢ to meaningfully engage grassroots membership so that together, we can lead on the big issues affecting health care.
‚Ä¢ to address diversity and equity in the profession, including issues such as the gender pay gap, access to mentorship, publication biases and missing rungs on the academic promotional ladder, and

Prior to Covid, my key priorities this year were:

‚Ä¢ to support physician health, tackling burnout and other systemic threats to our well-being

"But I also know that our patients still need the amazing care you offer routinely.‚ÄØ

I know this, and I know you. ‚ÄØ

So today in these challenging times, I promise you yet again:‚ÄØ

I will never stop fighting for ALL of us."

"I‚Äôm not naive.‚ÄØ

I know there are immense hurdles and challenges ahead.‚ÄØ

I know that our healthcare system ‚Äî as we know it ‚Äî is at risk.‚ÄØ

I know that my colleagues ‚Äî our members ‚Äî are struggling to get through the days, weeks and months yet ahead."

"And no matter how awful it may feel at times ‚Äî no matter how these may be the worst of times ‚Äî they are also the times that have brought out the best in doctors.‚ÄØ

You inspire me, and I will fight for you."
"Because ‚Äî and here‚Äôs the most important part of what I have to say ‚Äî we are all in this incredible, terrible, time together.‚ÄØ"

"I have heard you rail at the fiscal injustice of it all, and I rail at your side.‚ÄØ
I have seen you hold your patients‚Äô hands from a distance, keep your clinics open at personal risk and loss, and continue to show up.‚ÄØ

And I have shown up beside you, and cheered for you."

"I asked you all to join me in being bold, daring greatly, and accomplishing great things together.‚ÄØ

I knew they were big promises.‚ÄØ I knew it was a big ask. ‚ÄØNone of us knew how big.

I have heard you - my colleagues - crying out at the lack of PPE.‚ÄØ And I cry with you.‚ÄØ"

"We may be tired, bloodied, and yes fearful, but we are not done.‚ÄØ

It is not yet enough.‚ÄØ

Especially now and today, It is not yet enough.‚ÄØ

When I spoke last year, I promised to never stop fighting for All Of Us, to never stop leaning in."

"The last 4 years, we have tried to come together, repeatedly, to make things better.‚ÄØ

To enact change.‚ÄØ

To build transparency and trust.

To build unity.‚ÄØ

WE are not done.‚ÄØ"

"I see all of you, all of us.‚ÄØ

Your concerns are valid.‚ÄØ

Your emotions are valid.‚ÄØ

Your fear and angst and anger are valid.‚ÄØ

As your spokesperson and President ‚Äî I see you all."

"To our senior physicians who ‚Äì after dedicating a lifetime to the service of the people and communities of Ontario ‚Äî are now struggling with the Sophie‚Äôs choice of caring for others vs caring for yourselves, I see you."

"To the single parents juggling your children & patient duties, with the new challenge of social isolation ‚Äî I see you, you are not alone.‚ÄØ

To the sandwich generation, desperately trying to keep parents & children safe and connected, while safely separated ‚Äî I see you, too."

"To our junior colleagues ‚Äî still trying to find their way in this system ‚Äî now struggling with a plethora of additional challenges, and less mentorship and guidance than you may have foreseen ‚Äî I see you rise to this challenge.‚ÄØ"

"It has threatened our mental health.‚ÄØ

At a time when member burnout is already at an all-time high, for many of us, the challenges brought by COVID-19 threaten to overwhelm.‚ÄØ"

"Our society is seized by a medical and public health crisis I never foresaw.‚ÄØMost of us never did.‚ÄØ

It has threatened our lives and personal safety.‚ÄØ Worse, it has threatened our families and loved ones.‚ÄØ

And these are only the most obvious of threats."
"It was Charles Dickens who said: ‚ÄúIt was the best of times, it was the worst of times.‚Äù‚ÄØOf another time, place, and crisis of course, but still.‚ÄØ"

Council - I miss you all, much like I miss my friends and extended family.‚ÄØ

I miss being able to shake your hand, to look you in the eye, to sit with you and listen to your concerns.
"To @drmsgandhi, in particular, I say, thank you for steering us calmly through so many crises in a single year, and leaving such a giant void to fill."

It‚Äôs an honor to be here today, to be following in the footsteps of truly impressive physician leaders like @drmsgandhi, @DocSchmadia, and others.

I would not be here today without their support, mentorship and tutelage.
